page.title: 14LAW AND ORDER IN LONGSTANTON
page.content: In his eleven years here our local policeman has not encountered any really major crime.Most of his time is spent in dealing with minor offences, petty theft and vandalisim being the most common.The offenders are often adolescents or young adults, not infrequently soldiers. Our policeman is responsible for other villages too, and he has the use of a police panda car . He makes a point of being seen in it where he thinks there is a risk of trouble _ crime prevention being one of his most important functions. To this end he tries to foster a good relationship with the public, making himself as accessible as possible. In Longstanton the civil police are responsible for the married quarters but the millitary police handle most matters within the camp itself.
